hint.text:
Terms common to both the numerator and denominator can be cancelled.
For example :
\(\frac{x^3abc}{xab},\,\)where x, a, b, c are non-zero intergers; can be expressed as
\('x^2c'\,\)because \('xab'\,\)is the common term for the numerator and denominator.

solution.text:
\(\frac{_{j}_t^4-_{j}_s^4}{t-s}\)
Consider that LHS \(=_{j}_t^4-_{j}_s^4\)
\(=_{j}_(t^4-s^4)\)
\(=_{j}_(t^2-s^2)(t^2+s^2)\,\)[Using identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)]
\(=_{j}_(t-s)(t+s)(t^2+s^2)\,\)[Using identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)]
Therefore,
\(\frac{_{j}_t^4-_{j}_s^4}{t-s}\)
\(=\frac{_{j}_(t-s)(t+s)(t^2+s^2)}{t-s}\)
Dividing numerator and denominator by \((t-s)\),
\(=_{j}_(t+s)(t^2+s^2)\)
